result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley Thomas Wallace was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Conspiracy to Commit Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: Conspiracy], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: - Restitution set as follows: $10,645.31 payable to BMO Harris, $4,678.45 payable to Associated Bank, $6,413.19 payable to Capitol CU, $2,850.00 payable to Baylake Bank, $2,803.80 payable to Bank Mutual, $1,093.07 payable to Johnson Bank, $3,205.60 payable to TCF Bank, $3,914.64 payable to Waterstone Bank.  Total restitution is $35,604.06 to be paid joint and several with co-defendants Curtis Caffey, Latoya Jennings, Jameerah Morgan, Bradley Boswell.  Restitution to be collected by DOC from the defendant's wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account; an amount or percentage which the department determines is reasonable for restitution to victims; balance to be paid during extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

- Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments to be collected by DOC from defendant's wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account; an amount or a percentage which the department determines is reasonable; balance to be paid during extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
- Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from the defendant's wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account; an amount or a percentage which the department determines is reasonable; balance to be paid during extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count two.   Credit for 660 days.

superMiscConds.notes: - No contact with co-actors: Curtis Caffey, Latoya Jennings, Jameerah Morgan, Bradley Boswell.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count one.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts one and two.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bradley Thomas Wallace

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (38 pages) commencing DECEMBER 22, 2016, received and filed.  jm
Count three, Per Order/entry of 2/16/2017.

Correcting Judgment of Conviction, signed and filed.
     THEREFORE, IT IS HEREBY ORDERED, that the judgment of conviction shall be corrected to reflect that the extended supervision term on court three is three years.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Pedro A. Colon, Br. 18, for review. spc
Letter from DOC requesting a review of the defendant's sentence.
Original SENTENCING AMENDMENT Transcript (4 pages) commencing DECEMBER 28, 2016 received and filed.

Case in court to amend 12-22-2016 sentence as to Counts 1 and 2.  

As to Counts 1 and 2:  The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 5 years, consecutive to each other, credit for 660 day time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 2 years, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 years.
At the request of the parties, case is scheduled for sentence clarification on 12-28-2016 at 1:30 pm.

Defendant Bradley Thomas Wallace in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Bradley Thomas Wallace in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and defendant. 

As to Count 1:  The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 6 years, consecutive to Count 2 and any other sentence, credit for 660 days time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 2 years, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 years. 

As to Count 2:  The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 6 years, consecutive to Count 1 and any other sentence, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 2 years, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 years. 

As to Count 3 as Amended:  The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 6 years, concurrent to Counts 1 and 2, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 2 years, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 years. 

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION
- No contact with co-actors: Curtis Caffey, Latoya Jennings, Jameerah Morgan, Bradley Boswell. 
- Restitution set as follows: $10,645.31 payable to BMO Harris, $4,678.45 payable to Associated Bank, $6,413.19 payable to Capitol CU, $2,850.00 payable to Baylake Bank, $2,803.80 payable to Bank Mutual, $1,093.07 payable to Johnson Bank, $3,205.60 payable to TCF Bank, $3,914.64 payable to Waterstone Bank.  Total restitution is $35,604.06 to be paid joint and several with co-defendants Curtis Caffey, Latoya Jennings, Jameerah Morgan, Bradley Boswell.  Restitution to be collected by DOC from the defendant's wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account; an amount or percentage which the department determines is reasonable for restitution to victims; balance to be paid during extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
- Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments to be collected by DOC from defendant's wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account; an amount or a percentage which the department determines is reasonable; balance to be paid during extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
- Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from the defendant's wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account; an amount or a percentage which the department determines is reasonable; balance to be paid during extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment. 

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Attorney Frederick F Klimetz in court, defendant Bradley Thomas Wallace not in court, in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for sentencing hearing.  Parties jointly request an adjourned date.  Neither party wishes to address the court on the record.  Case adjourned to Branch 18.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 22, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Frederick F Klimetz in court, defendant Bradley Thomas Wallace not in court, in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LNR  
Held off the record. Case set for Sentencing.  Parties requests an adjournment. Defense counsel and the Defendant are working with the State on plea negotiations. Case adjourned for sentencing on 11/22/2016 at 08:30 am, branch 18.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Frederick F Klimetz in court, defendant Bradley Thomas Wallace not in court, in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for sentencing.  Parties requested an adjournment.  Matter is adjourned to August 26, 2016 at 8:30am in Br. 18, Judge Colon's court.

ALL PARTIES WERE NOTIFIED AS OF AUGUST 1, 2016, THIS CASE WILL BE REASSIGNED TO JUDGE PEDRO COLON, BRANCH #18, IN ROOM 635 OF THE COURTHOUSE, DUE TO JUDICIAL ROTATION.
Deputy Court Clerk tg
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Bradley Thomas Wallace in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Bradley Thomas Wallace in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
*JUDGE BOROWSKI FOR JUDGE CONEN*
Case calendared for plea hearing.  Amended infomation filed, amending Count 3 to Forgery-Uttering [Conspiracy], contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.32(2) and 939.31, a Class H Felony.  Negotiations placed on the record by the state.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2 AND 3: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a judgment of conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. PSI was not ordered. Case set for sentencing on 7/13/16 at 1:30 pm in Branch 30.
ADA Robles contacted the clerk and indicated that the May 31, 2016 Jury Trial date is now a plea date.  The Court approved this change.
State's Summary of Expert Testimony Pursuant to Wisconsin Statute Section 971.23(1)(e) and 907.02, received and filed.
from Defendant dated 4/21/16, received and filed.

Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.
AS TO COUNT 3: 
Court ordered charge amended to Conspiracy to Commit Forgery (Uttering), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 943.38(2), 939.31, a Class H felony.
State to prepare an additional amended copy with clarifying language as to other counts.

Defendant Bradley Thomas Wallace in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Bradley Thomas Wallace in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for projected guilty plea. State's offer put on the record. Court will not accept any further negotiations. Scheduling order signed and filed. All documents/motions are to be filed no later than 4/29/16. Case adjourned in branch 30.  Jury trial scheduled for May 31, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Frederick F Klimetz in court (via telephone), defendant Bradley Thomas Wallace not in court, in custody.  David Robles appeared (via telephone) for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a status conference.  Matter set for a plea hearing on April 13, 2016 at 1:30pm in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.

Matter here for a status of counsel.  Attorney Klimetz was recently appointed for the Defendant.  A stipulated request for a new court date, received and filed.  Matter is adjourned to February 1, 2016 at 8:30am for a scheduling conference in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.

Defendant Bradley Thomas Wallace in court with Attorney Eric Richard Hart.  Defendant Bradley Thomas Wallace in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for Defendant's Motion to Withdraw.  Arguments heard.  The Court GRANTED the Defendant's Motion.  The Court VACATED the December 16, 2015 motion hearing date.  Matter is set for a status of counsel on January 6, 2016 at 1:30pm in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.

Matter here for a Plea/Sentencing.  Matter is adjourned for Motion in Limine and Pretrial Motion hearings.  Matter is set for a Motion Hearing on November 9, 205 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.

Attorney Eric Richard Hart in court, defendant Bradley Thomas Wallace not in court, in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case is adjourned in branch 30.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defense counsel Eric Hart appears.  Defendant in custody not produced for today's hearing. David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court has had an opportunity to review appropriate statutes regarding rights of substitution on multi-co-defendant cases.  Court vacates the substitution for reasons stated on the record.  Defendant does not need to be produced for the next court date.  Court orders case returned to originating court Branch 30 Judge Conen for status conference on 9/9/2015 at 8:30 am.

Defendant Bradley Wallace in custody not produced.  Defense attorney Eric Hart in court.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk   Court raises issue regarding  rights of substitution on multi-co-defendant cases.  Case adjourned to 1:30 pm to allow parties to investigate the issue.
Per the request for substitution against Judge Conen (post-rotation) filed by defense.  The newly assigned court is Judge Cimpl's Court.
against Judge Conen (post-rotation) filed by defense.  The newly assigned court is Judge Cimpl's Court.
